science.headline: For EPA Pollution Rules, the Value of Human Health Is Changing
science.teaser: A document published this month reveals that the EPA is changing how it conducts the cost-benefit analysis of regulations for two major pollutants: particulate matter called PM2.5 and ozone. In a reversal of previous policy, the EPA will stop using the dollar value of lives saved and hospital visits
science.tldr: Alters method for evaluating costs and health impacts of pollution rules
